clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Key Electro-acupuncture Technique on Migraine
clinical_study.official_title: Study of Key Electro-acupuncture Technique on Migraine

lead_sponsor.agency: Shanghai University of Traditional Chinese Medicine

clinical_study.source: Shanghai University of Traditional Chinese Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: A random controlled trail to evaluate the efficacy of migraine standard electroacupuncture formula, and to analysis the regulation of the intensity-effects and to observe the peripheral NO, CGRP and NF-кB expression level of migraine patients after electroacupuncture treatment.

detailed_description.textblock: acupuncture group(group A): treated by acupuncture for 20 days, 1 time per day control group(group B): treated by FlunarizineHydrochloride for 20 days, 1 table per day.

primary_outcome.description: a scientifically reliable and valid measure of migraine disability that can improve communication between patients and physicians, assess migraine severity and act as an outcome measure to monitor treatment efficacy

secondary_outcome.measure: The medical outcomes study 36-item short-form health survey(SF-36)
secondary_outcome.description: A 36-item short-form (SF-36) was constructed to survey health status in the Medical Outcomes Study

secondary_outcome.measure: peripheral Calcitonin gene related peptide(CGRP) protein expression
peripheral Nuclear factor-kappa B(NF-кB) protein expression
Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) to assess pain
secondary_outcome.description: Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) were applied to measure pain in patients

arm_group.description: 100hz, 2min. electro-acupoint: LI4(Large Intestine4) with LV3(Liver3).5times a week. lasting for 4 weeks.
one tablet of flunarizine hydrochloride tablet per day. lasting for 20days

intervention.description: electro-acupuncture on acupoints according to the traditional syndrome diagnosis.once per day, for 20 days.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- met the diagnostic criteria for migraine; suffering from migraine attacks; migraine attacks for more than 5 days per month, and lasts for 3 months; voluntarily join this study with informed consents.
Exclusion Criteria:
- other systemic, neurological and psychiatric disorders; headache caused by other diseases; not treatment compliance during the study.
